info.title: ServiceNow Custom Sample
info.description: A sample connector for ServiceNow with basic CRUD for Incidents, OAuth and attachment support

get.description: Retrieves the specific user record using the provided Id parameter.
Returns the metadata of the attachment file provided a specific System ID for the attachment

parameters.name: sys_id
parameters.description: System ID of the attachment record for which to retrieve the metadata.

delete.description: This method deletes the attachment for a provided System ID value

parameters.name: sys_id
parameters.description: System ID of the attachment record to delete.

get.description: Returns the metadata for multiple attachments.

parameters.name: sysparm_limit
parameters.description: Limit to be applied on pagination.

parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description: Encoded query. Queries for the Attachment API are relative to the Attachments [sys_attachment] table.

get.description: Returns the binary file attachment for the specified System ID record of attachment

parameters.name: sys_id
parameters.description: System ID of the attachment record from which to return binary data.

post.description: Uploads a specified binary file as an attachment to a specified record.  The file to attach must be specified after the last parameter in the passed-in request parameter list.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to attach the file to.

parameters.name: table_sys_id
parameters.description: System ID of the record in the table as specified in Table Name.

get.description: Retrieves a list of incidents from ServiceNow

parameters.name: sysparm_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description: Encoded query used to filter the result set

location.title: Location
location.description: Where the caller or service is located

reopen_count.title: Reopen count
reopen_count.description: Number of times Incident state has changed from REsolved or Closed to another state

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: Measures of the business criticality of the affected service

urgency.title: Urgency
urgency.description: Measure of the business criticality based on the impact and on the business needs

sla_due.description: Date by which the SLA expects this task to be completed
sla_due.title: SLA due

business_duration.description: Business time elapsed before task was closed
business_duration.title: Business duration

activity_due.description: Date by which the Inactivity Monitor expects the task to be updated
activity_due.title: Activity due

caller_id.title: Caller ID
caller_id.description: Person who reported or is affected by this incident

comments_and_work_notes.description: Combined output of Additional comments and Work notes
comments_and_work_notes.title: Comments and work notes

parent_incident.title: Parent incident
parent_incident.description: Can be used to collect incidents for the same root issue

child_incidents.description: Number of child incidents related to this problem
child_incidents.title: Child incidents

assigned_to.title: Assigned to
assigned_to.description: Person primarily responsible for working this task

sys_domain_path.title: Domain path
sys_domain_path.description: Domain to which the task belongs

DisplaySystemRefs.name: sysparm_display_value
DisplaySystemRefs.description: Determines if system references should be included

DisplayInputSystemRefs.name: sysparm_input_display_value
DisplayInputSystemRefs.description: Flag that indicates whether to set field values using the display value or the actual value

ExcludeRefLinks.name: sysparm_exclude_reference_link
ExcludeRefLinks.description: Determines if reference links should be excluded
